results.title: Adventuring pups
results.creator_credit: Young America Films and Morton Schindel
results.brief_description: A film designed to stimulate observation in the young child, by introducing three puppies, and following their adventures on a farm and in the woods.

results.title: Adventuring in conservation
results.creator_credit: Indiana University and American Camping Association
results.brief_description: Shows boys and girls as they discover the interdependence of plants and animals in nature’s communities. How man destroys or upsets these communities; the importance of natural resources and what we can do to conserve them; camping practices which will help conserve natural resources.

results.title: Adventures of two little goats
results.brief_description: Designed for use in primary classes, this film illustrates the habits and characteristics of goats, and shows typical scenes of farm life. Tells of the adventures of twin goats when they set out to explore a large pasture for the first time.

results.title: Adventures of Jimmy
results.brief_description: A picturesque account of the search of a particularly naive young man for his ideal mate in the big city (San Francisco) and his rather overwhelming success at the film’s conclusion. Though told with tongue in cheek, it has a lot to say about loneliness in a busy world. Stylistically, “Adventures of Jimmy” takes a not undeserved poke at those psychoanalytical literary travelogues so popular in the 1950’s featuring the neurotic as hero. Mr Broughton reads the commentary while Weldon Kees, himself a poet and painter, arranged and plays the musical accompaniment. Written by James Broughton. Photography by Frank Stauffacher.

results.title: Adventures of Dollie
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: Kidnapped from her family’s yard by a vengeful gypsy, Dolly is placed in a barrel which travels down a stream and over a waterfall. A young angler fishes the barrel from the river, and the family is reunited. Cast includes Arthur Johnson, Linda Arvidson, Charles Inslee, Madeline West. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: Adventures of Captain Africa: mighty jungle avenger. Vol. 2
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Sam Katzman and Spencer Bennet
results.brief_description: Captain Africa helps the Arabian caliph Hamid to regain his throne which has been stolen from him by a rival. Aided by adventurer Ted Arnold, hunter Nat Coleman, his assistant Omar and Arabian princess Rhoda, Captain Africa battles wild animals, the usurper’s army and a pair of white adventurers. For some reason this movie serial was banned in Finland. Cast includes John Hart, Rick Vallin, Ben Welden, June Howard, Bud Osborne, Paul Marion, Lee Roberts.

results.title: Adventures of Bunny Rabbit (K)
results.brief_description: Story of a mother rabbit and her very hungry son, Bunny Rabbit, who goes in search of fresh lettuce on a nearby farm. After several encounters with other animals and two narrow escapes from a hungry fox and an angry farmer, Bunny hurries home, much wiser about the ways of the outside world. Designed to teach younger children the features and habits of rabbits and other woodland and farm animals. No other credits available.

results.title: Adventures of a young eagle
results.creator_credit: Hungarofilm, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Istvan Nagy
results.brief_description: The adventures of three young eagles living at the very top of a tree. One is frightened out of the nest while the parent birds are away. His survival illustrates that “learning” is an exciting part of the adventures of a young eagle. Designed to stimulate children to observe things around them, and stimulate creative expression.
